page.title: 16FARMING,FISHING INDUSTRY
page.content: MR CLARKE HAS BEEN A FISHERMAN AT NORMANS BAY FOR SIX YEARS. HIS BOAT THE KELLY GAL, IS TWENTY FEET LONG. IT COST JUST UNDER Â£1000 SECOND HAND. IT RUNS ON DIESEL OIL. HE GOES OUT EIGHT MILES TO THE WATERS BY THE SOVEREIGN LIGHTHOUSE TO FISH. THE WATER HERE IS 17-20 METRES DEEP. TRAMMEL NETS ARE USED, FIXED TO THE BOAT. THE FISHERMEN GO OUT WHEN THERE IS A FULL TIDE, BUT NOT WHEN THERE ARE GALE FORCE WINDS. THEY STAY OUT AT SEA FOR 6-7 HOURS. THEY SELL PLAICE, COD, SOLE, DABS, AND SKATE. ONE OF THE FISHERMEN'S WIVES SAYS IT IS SO PEACEFUL IN NORMANS BAY. SHE HAS LIVED THERE FOR 38 YEARS. SHE HAD WATER LAID INTO HER HOUSE ONLY 16 YEARS AGO. SHE GOES IN HER HUSBAND'S FISHING BOAT TO THE SHOPS IN BEXHILL. AS A CHILD SHE LIVED IN LONDON BUT WOULDN'T WANT TO GO BACK. SHE THINKS EVERYONE IS SO FRIENDLY HERE.
